definition: broken mirror/fig. broken marriage/divorce
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
mirror/lens
a shattered mirror put back together (idiom)/(of marriage) to pick up the pieces and start anew/for a separated couple to reconcile and reunite

sentences.english: I would highly suggest that you commit The Clean Slate Method to memory.
sentences.chinese: 我强烈建议，你把破镜重圆法刻入脑海深处。

sentences.english: The statement added that the couple hoped to be able to repair the marriage.
sentences.chinese: 这分声明还表示，这对夫妇仍然希望能破镜重圆。

sentences.english: From that story comes the idiom "A broken mirror joined together".
sentences.chinese: “破镜重圆”这个成语就是从这个故事来的。

sentences.english: Your child may have harbored hopes that you and your ex-spouse would reunite.
sentences.chinese: 你的孩子也许仍对父母破镜重圆心存希望。

sentences.english: Xiao Chen's ex-wife has also expressed her wish to return to him.
sentences.chinese: 而陈景的前妻也向小陈表达了破镜重圆的意愿。

sentences.english: Do you and Mom ever think about getting back together?
sentences.chinese: 你想过和母亲破镜重圆吗？

sentences.english: The boy hid the fragments of broken mirror under the sofa.
sentences.chinese: 男孩把破镜的碎片拼藏在沙发底下。

sentences.english: Three months later husband and wife were back together.
sentences.chinese: 三个月后，夫妻二人破镜重圆。

sentences.english: Xiao bao Lin and the road the little friends can get together again?
sentences.chinese: 林小宝和马路这对小冤家是否能够破镜重圆？

sentences.english: Can you glue the broken mirror?
sentences.chinese: 你能把这个破镜黏合吗？。

sentences.english: From this story comes the idiom "a broken mirror joined together."
sentences.chinese: “破镜重圆”这个成语就是从这个故事来的。

definition: a shattered mirror put back together (idiom)/(of marriage) to pick up the pieces and start anew/for a separated couple to reconcile and reunite

to make friends again/to renew old cordial relations
to part without hard feelings (idiom)/to cut the knot as smoothly as you tied it
to release (tension)/relief (from suspense)/to dispel (usu. with negative, unable to forget)
lit. a good horse doesn't turn around and graze the same patch again (idiom)/fig. once you've moved on, don't go back again (romantic relationship, job etc)/leave the past behind

definition: as before/as ever

to remarry (the same person)
lovers

lit. lotus roots may break, but the fiber remains joined (idiom); lovers part, but still long for one another
love is more solid than gold (idiom)
a prodigal son returned home is worth more than gold
